posts.post_content:
Wow! It's funny to see that instead of changing the creature types of this cycle, they kept them as Mongers - and in 4 out of 5 cases, **ADDED** a creature type to each!
  
   
All of the mongers are pretty awesome for multiplayer enthusiasts, but this one is especially interesting from a diplomatic point of view - if you tap out to cast it, it's entirely possible that one opponent might pay to save this guy if another opponent tries to pull a fast one with removal!
posts.html:
Wow! It's funny to see that instead of changing the creature types of this cycle, they kept them as Mongers - and in 4 out of 5 cases, ADDED a creature type to each!

All of the mongers are pretty awesome for multiplayer enthusiasts, but this one is especially interesting from a diplomatic point of view - if you tap out to cast it, it's entirely possible that one opponent might pay to save this guy if another opponent tries to pull a fast one with removal!

posts.post_content:
Should've known what was coming given that the sideboard consisted of a singleton Sol Ring (with the cool new art!), but who would know to anticipate this?  
  
24 Plains  
4 Golden Wish  
4 Adarkar Unicorn  
4 Benevolent Unicorn  
4 Capashen Unicorn  
4 Pearled Unicorn  
4 Regal Unicorn  
4 Revered Unicorn  
4 Ronom Unicorn  
3 Soaring Hope  
...and 1 Wishmonger, with a handwritten line underneath the flavor text: "Will you marry me?"  
  
Answer: "Yes, dear. But only if you learn to build better decks." <3

posts.post_content:
Oddly enough, it's ability targets, so if you are playing a multicolor deck and someone tries to use Wishmonger to give their creature protection from your other color, you can respond by using the ability to give it **pro white**, causing their use of the ability to be countered.  
  
Also, Two-Headed Giant.
posts.html:
Oddly enough, it's ability targets, so if you are playing a multicolor deck and someone tries to use Wishmonger to give their creature protection from your other color, you can respond by using the ability to give it pro white, causing their use of the ability to be countered.

Also, Two-Headed Giant.
